storyTitle: As Team Lead, I want to view task status reports to achieve real-time monitoring of task progress and completion

testCases.title: Generate task status report with valid filters
preconditions: User is logged in as Team Lead with valid credentials
User has authorization to access task status reporting
Task management database contains task data with various statuses
At least one project exists with tasks in pending, in-progress, and completed statuses
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to Task Status Reporting section from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Task status report UI is displayed with filter options including project, team, and priority dropdowns

steps.action: Select a valid project from the project filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Selected project is highlighted and displayed in the filter field without errors

steps.action: Select a valid priority level from the priority filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Selected priority is highlighted and displayed in the filter field without errors

steps.action: Click the 'Generate Report' button to submit report generation request
steps.expectedResult: Task status report is generated and displayed within 5 seconds showing tasks categorized by pending, in-progress, and completed statuses matching the selected filters

steps.action: Verify the report displays task count for each status category
steps.expectedResult: Report shows accurate count of tasks in pending, in-progress, and completed categories

steps.action: Verify the report contains only tasks matching the applied filters
steps.expectedResult: All displayed tasks belong to the selected project and priority level

postconditions: Task status report is displayed on screen
Report data matches the applied filters
User remains logged in
System is ready for additional filter changes or export actions

testCases.title: Export task status report to PDF and Excel
preconditions: User is logged in as Team Lead with valid credentials
User has authorization to access task status reporting
Task status report has been generated and is displayed on screen
Browser allows file downloads
Sufficient disk space available for file downloads

steps.action: Generate task status report by selecting project and priority filters and clicking 'Generate Report'
steps.expectedResult: Report is displayed on screen with task data categorized by status

steps.action: Locate and click the 'Export to PDF' button
steps.expectedResult: PDF file download is initiated and file is downloaded to the default download location

steps.action: Open the downloaded PDF file
steps.expectedResult: PDF opens successfully and contains the correct report data with all task statuses, filters applied, and proper formatting

steps.action: Return to the task status report page in the application
steps.expectedResult: Report is still displayed with the same filter settings

steps.action: Locate and click the 'Export to Excel' button
steps.expectedResult: Excel file download is initiated and file is downloaded to the default download location

steps.action: Open the downloaded Excel file
steps.expectedResult: Excel file opens successfully and contains the correct report data with all task statuses in structured columns, filters applied, and data is editable

steps.action: Verify both exported files contain identical data matching the on-screen report
steps.expectedResult: PDF and Excel files contain the same task information, counts, and status categories as displayed in the UI

postconditions: PDF file is successfully downloaded and contains accurate report data
Excel file is successfully downloaded and contains accurate report data
Original report remains displayed on screen
User remains logged in
No data corruption or loss occurred during export

testCases.title: Verify real-time update of task status report
preconditions: User is logged in as Team Lead with valid credentials
User has authorization to access task status reporting
At least one project exists with tasks in various statuses
Real-time update mechanism is enabled and functioning
Backend task management system is accessible
WebSocket or polling mechanism for real-time updates is active

steps.action: Navigate to Task Status Reporting section and select a specific project
steps.expectedResult: Task status report UI is displayed with current task statuses for the selected project

steps.action: Note the current count of tasks in each status category (pending, in-progress, completed)
steps.expectedResult: Task counts are clearly visible for each status category

steps.action: Using backend access or another user session, update the status of a task from 'pending' to 'in-progress' in the task management system
steps.expectedResult: Task status is successfully updated in the backend database

steps.action: Monitor the task status report UI without refreshing the page
steps.expectedResult: Report UI updates automatically within 10 seconds showing the changed task status

steps.action: Verify the task count in 'pending' category decreased by 1
steps.expectedResult: Pending task count is reduced by 1 from the previously noted count

steps.action: Verify the task count in 'in-progress' category increased by 1
steps.expectedResult: In-progress task count is increased by 1 from the previously noted count

steps.action: Update another task status from 'in-progress' to 'completed' in the backend
steps.expectedResult: Task status is successfully updated in the backend database

steps.action: Monitor the report UI for automatic updates
steps.expectedResult: Report shows the latest task status information with in-progress count decreased by 1 and completed count increased by 1 within 10 seconds

steps.action: Verify all task status changes are accurately reflected in the report
steps.expectedResult: Report displays current and accurate task status information matching the backend data

postconditions: Task status report displays the most recent task status information
Real-time update mechanism continues to function
All task status changes are accurately reflected
User remains logged in
No manual page refresh was required

storyTitle: As Team Lead, I want to filter task status reports by priority to achieve focused monitoring of critical tasks

testCases.title: Filter task status report by valid priority
preconditions: User is logged in as Team Lead with valid credentials
User has authorization to access task status reporting
Task database contains tasks with different priority levels (High, Medium, Low)
At least one task exists for each priority level
Task Status Reporting section is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to Task Status Reporting section from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Task status report UI is displayed with filter options including priority dropdown

steps.action: Locate the priority filter dropdown and click to expand it
steps.expectedResult: Priority dropdown expands showing available priority options (High, Medium, Low)

steps.action: Select 'High' priority from the filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Priority filter is applied and 'High' is displayed as the selected value in the dropdown

steps.action: Click the 'Generate Report' button
steps.expectedResult: Report is generated within 5 seconds and displays task status data only for tasks with High priority

steps.action: Verify all tasks displayed in the report have 'High' priority
steps.expectedResult: All tasks shown in pending, in-progress, and completed categories have High priority designation

steps.action: Verify no tasks with Medium or Low priority are displayed
steps.expectedResult: Report contains only High priority tasks, excluding all Medium and Low priority tasks

steps.action: Change the priority filter to 'Medium' and regenerate the report
steps.expectedResult: Report updates to display only Medium priority tasks across all status categories

steps.action: Verify the filtered report accuracy for Medium priority
steps.expectedResult: All displayed tasks have Medium priority and no High or Low priority tasks are shown

postconditions: Task status report displays only tasks matching the selected priority filter
Filter selection is retained until changed by user
User remains logged in
System is ready for export or additional filter modifications

testCases.title: Handle invalid priority filter input
preconditions: User is logged in as Team Lead with valid credentials
User has authorization to access task status reporting
Task Status Reporting section is accessible
Priority filter accepts manual input or has validation mechanism

steps.action: Navigate to Task Status Reporting section
steps.expectedResult: Task status report UI is displayed with priority filter field

steps.action: Enter an invalid priority value 'InvalidPriority' in the priority filter field
steps.expectedResult: System displays a validation error message indicating 'Invalid priority value. Please select from: High, Medium, Low'

steps.action: Verify the error message is clearly visible and user-friendly
steps.expectedResult: Error message is displayed in red text near the priority filter field with clear instructions

steps.action: Click the 'Generate Report' button while invalid priority is entered
steps.expectedResult: Report generation is blocked and system displays error message 'Please correct the priority filter before generating report'

steps.action: Verify no report is generated with invalid filter
steps.expectedResult: No report data is displayed and the generate button remains inactive or shows validation error

steps.action: Enter a numeric value '123' in the priority filter field
steps.expectedResult: System displays validation error message indicating invalid priority format

steps.action: Attempt to generate report with numeric invalid input
steps.expectedResult: Report generation is blocked until valid input is provided

steps.action: Clear the invalid input and select a valid priority 'High' from the dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Validation error disappears and 'High' priority is accepted

steps.action: Click 'Generate Report' with valid priority selected
steps.expectedResult: Report is successfully generated displaying High priority tasks within 5 seconds

postconditions: System validates priority filter input before report generation
Invalid inputs are rejected with clear error messages
Report generation only proceeds with valid priority values
User remains logged in
No corrupted data is processed

storyTitle: As Team Lead, I want to export task status reports in Excel format to achieve detailed offline analysis

testCases.title: Export task status report to Excel
preconditions: User is logged in as Team Lead with authorized role
Task status report data is available in the system
User has permissions to access task status reports
Browser supports file downloads
Network connection is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the task status reports section
steps.expectedResult: Task status reports page is displayed with available report options

steps.action: Select desired filters or parameters for the task status report (if applicable)
steps.expectedResult: Selected filters are applied and highlighted in the UI

steps.action: Click on 'Generate Report' button
steps.expectedResult: Task status report is generated and displayed on screen with all task data including status, assignees, dates, and other relevant fields

steps.action: Verify the displayed report contains accurate task status information
steps.expectedResult: Report shows correct task data matching the current system state

steps.action: Locate and click on 'Export to Excel' button
steps.expectedResult: Export process initiates and Excel file download begins within 5 seconds

steps.action: Wait for the Excel file download to complete
steps.expectedResult: Excel file is successfully downloaded to the default download location with filename format 'TaskStatusReport_YYYY-MM-DD.xlsx'

steps.action: Navigate to the download location and locate the downloaded Excel file
steps.expectedResult: Excel file is present in the downloads folder with correct filename and non-zero file size

steps.action: Open the downloaded Excel file using Microsoft Excel or compatible spreadsheet application
steps.expectedResult: Excel file opens without errors and displays the task status report data

steps.action: Verify all columns are present (Task ID, Task Name, Status, Assignee, Start Date, Due Date, Priority, etc.)
steps.expectedResult: All expected columns are present with proper headers

steps.action: Verify data integrity by comparing sample records from the Excel file with the original report displayed in the system
steps.expectedResult: Data in Excel file matches exactly with the data shown in the system report

steps.action: Check formatting of the Excel file including column widths, headers, and data alignment
steps.expectedResult: Excel file maintains proper formatting with readable column widths, bold headers, and appropriate data alignment

steps.action: Verify that dates are formatted correctly in Excel date format
steps.expectedResult: All date fields are displayed in proper Excel date format (MM/DD/YYYY or system default)

steps.action: Check that all rows from the report are exported without truncation
steps.expectedResult: Row count in Excel matches the total number of tasks in the generated report

postconditions: Excel file remains in the download folder
Original report remains displayed in the system
No data is modified in the system
Export action is logged in the system audit trail
User can perform additional exports if needed
